title.narrative: Improving Food Security and WASH of the flood affected communities of Katihar Bihar through Early R

description.narrative:
Agricutlure will help restore the livelihoods of affected people through revival of agriculture by distributing maize seeds and micro nutrient to grow crops suitable for sandy mix muddy soil in the affected area
Nutrition improvement through Kitchen gardening will provide seasonal vegetable seeds for ensuring nutrition of them though kitchen gardening.
Water, sanitation and hygiene will reduce diarrheal diseases and improvement of sanitation practices. We will cover the overall schools in the Luttipur Gram Panchayat and educate them about sanitation and hygiene practices with safety measures.
Preparedness for reducing disaster risk will form the GTF, orient and trained them about early information accessibility, light Search and Rescue, First aid, Emergency shelter management, Alternative livelihood etc. We will be emphasize cluster level preparedness through the support of live saving equipment’s.

An integrated, multipronged approach for economic recovery of the affected area as per build back better concept, and improvement of WASH facilities through model raised iron removal plant and gender segregated raised toilet construction with hygiene campaign are required to ensure the protection of the most vulnerable members (Dalit and excluded families) of society and to resume socioeconomic development in the affected wards of Luttipur Gram Panchayat. The Government suggested to PGVS for prepare the medium-term recovery program for sustainable production in agriculture, and model demonstration related to WASH with improved risk resistance capacity in various sectors through Disaster Risk Reduction approaches. The Project comprises five parts: (A) agriculture (B), Nutrition improvement through Kitchen gardening (C), Water, sanitation and hygiene (D), Preparedness for reducing disaster risk (E). Strengthen partnerships and synergies with other development partners.
